column2: peny_lane2, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I had extreme itching on my right forearm and elbow. I tried a regiment of prescription drugs to no avail. My doctor prescibed Clobetasol Propionate and it immediately soothed the itching and healed the problem within 24 hours. It has been over a year since I had the itching. Today, I noticed a spot starting to sting on my elbow again. I got the Clobetasol Propionate out and used it. No more problems. I would recommend this prescription ointment for anyone who has a stinging/itcing skin problem that cannot be diagnosed by a physician.

column2: netters, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had a tiny and big fluid filled blisters on my hands and big toes for over 30 years. It comes and goes. I went to my foot doctor and he scrapped the blister to test it for viral infection . It came back neg. Then he took the fluid out of the big blister on my toe to test for bacterial infection. It came back neg. Then he wanted to cut out a peice of skin to test it. I decided to get a second opinion and I am glad I did. The skin physcian place ,doctor took one look at my feet and said it was DISHYDROTIC ECXZEMA. He said it is hereditary and if one sibling has it more then likely they all do. He was right. My 3 sisters have it. just different forms of eczema. After all these years I finally have a answer to what this stuff is... I have allergys and am allergic to foods and medicines. The doc said that people who have allergies usually have eczema of some sort. I am allergic to latex ,bandaids,neosporin,cheap shoes ,rubber and so many dies purfumes and so much more. No one was ever able to figure this out except the skin doctor.I am so glad that I finally know after all the other doctors couldnt figure it out ...This med seems to work and will use for the rest of my life since eczema will never be cured.It will just take it away and then it will come back. For all those people My symtoms of this DISHYDROTIC ECZEMA were first it would be sharp pains in the toe like being stuck with a needles  and on my big toe. Then a day or so later the blisters would fill with fluid,and be very ichy. Then after the blisters were there for a week or more then it would turn dark red even almost dark purple . Then it would get hard and dry and I could peel it off like a scab,after about 3 weeks. Very painful blisters. To anyone that has this or thinks maybe they do go to the skin specialist for a diagnosis so you dont have to go thru all the pain and scrapping of the skin like I did. Very painful it was and for nothing. All there test were neg.. I will only go to the skin doctor.

column2: Minesweeper, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My dermatologist diagnosed eczema as the cause of recurring rash like symptoms between my fingers; primarily the left hand. She prescribed CLOBETASOL PROPIONATE USP 0.05% CREAM as a treatment.Unfortunately I have not had the RX long enough to evaluate the effect but it seems to clear up the continuous low level itching. I handle a lot of plants, grasses, leaves and other outdoor substances quite a lot. I'm also under treatment for rather severe allergies. For the first time in more than 40+ years I have, thus far, gone through this season with NO allergenic outbreaks at all. I take injections (2) twice a week. I'm not sure if/how all this is connected but I'm heartened by the positive comments from male users of this drug for skin diseases of various intensities.

column9: I have had Discoid Lupus Erythematosus and had this disease for about 10 years now. I started on plagenil for about a month and then Triamcinolone cream 0.1% for a bit thenI had the lesions stuck with steriod shots,had a few lesions removed.since getting out of the navy, the Vetrans Affairs had me on Hydroxychloroquine (with no side effects) medication and these creams like Triamcinolone cream 0.1%. Ive used the Clobetasol Propionate 0.05% and now I'm on the Triamcinolone cream 0.025% for the most part they clear up but not a 100% I also use coppertone 70 spf when im at work

column9: After 2 months of extreme vaginal itching, I was diagnosed with vulvar dystrophy. C.B. cream usp,.05% was my lifesaver.The itching stopped almost immediately.After 4 wk treatment,I was told I would remain in this 2x/week for the rest of my life.I am 71.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have severe eczema on the palms of my hands and fingers (flaking, cracking and bleeding). I work in a warehouse so I have to constantly protect my hands with either band-aids or worse .. gloves. The first time I used this ointment it was great. I used it for two weeks and my hands cleared up. I applied it during a second outbreak and nothing happened. For me, sometimes it works and sometimes it dosn't. I find it works best when you moisturize often with a 'safe' moisturizer like Cetaphil or Eucerine. My Dr. recomends the ointment over the cream. The ointment can be messy (like vasoline) but gets absorbed rather quickly. If anyone would like to contact me with tips for help (or for tips for help) with ezcema feel free to contact me at hubum@yahoo.com - any help is good right?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have psoriasis, but at this point it seems more like a memory at times. after two applications, I cried seeing my knees for the first time without blotchieness in maybe 10-14 years. I do find that it now seems to work better on one knee than the other, but I'm still for the first time feeling normal, less like a circus freak
